message:
Evacuation of the Palestinian population from southern Khan Yunis and northern Rafah

This morning, the IDF spokesperson called on Gazans in the neighborhoods: Al-Manara, al-Salam, Subah, Al-Hashash, Kizan-e-Najjar, Kizan-Rashuan and Jorat-e-Luth to evacuate their homes to the humanitarian zone.
These neighborhoods are located in the south of Khan Yunis and in the north of Rafah.

Beyond that, the IDF announced another significant announcement about the reduction of the humanitarian area as you can see in the attached video.
The IDF spokesman announced that the IDF intends to operate in this area - it is a combat area.

I will mention that the rescue of the 5 bodies of the abductees on Wednesday was carried out from an area that was initially defined as a humanitarian area, but was reduced before the ground operation in the area.
location: Based on the text, the most specific location mentioned is the southern neighborhoods of Khan Yunis and
event_breakdown:
Event: Evacuation of the Palestinian population from southern Khan Yunis and northern Rafah
Date: 05.08.2021
Location: Al-Manara, al-Salam, Subah, Al-Hashash, Kizan-e-Najjar, Kizan-Rashuan and Jorat-e-Luth neighborhoods in southern Khan Yunis and northern Rafah
Description: The IDF called on residents of these neighborhoods to evacuate their homes to the humanitarian zone, as they are located in a combat area.

message:
IDF Spokesperson:

This morning (Saturday) terrorists fired at a military position at one of the entrances to Nablus in the Samaria Division. The shooting was apparently carried out from deep within the Nablus area.
IDF forces are conducting searches in the area.

As a result of the shooting, an IDF soldier was slightly injured and was taken to a hospital for medical treatment, his family was informed.
event_breakdown: IDF searches for terrorists who fired on military position in Nablus, IDF soldier injured

message:
The Palestinians report that the IDF attacked "Ahmad el-Kourd" (a-Salah) school about two hours after the Khadija school was attacked in Deir al-Balah. The two schools are adjacent to each other.
The "Ahmed el-Kourd" school was attacked three times over the course of an hour, according to the Palestinians but following an evacuation warning. That is - it was empty at the time of the attacks.

message:
IDF: The IDF struck terrorists operating a Hamas command and control center embedded inside the Khadija School in central Gaza

In a strike based on precise IDF and ISA intelligence, terrorists operating in a Hamas command and control center inside the Khadija school compound in central Gaza were struck by the IAF. 

Hamas terrorists used the compound as a hiding place to direct and plan numerous attacks against IDF troops and the State of Israel. In parallel, the terrorists developed and stored large quantities of weapons inside the compound. 

Prior to the strike, numerous steps were taken to mitigate the risk of harming civilians, including the use of appropriate munitions, aerial surveillance and additional intelligence. 

This is a further example of the Hamas terrorist organization’s systematic violation of international law and exploitation of civilian structures and population as human shields for its attacks against the State of Israel.
event_breakdown: IDF struck terrorists operating a Hamas command and control center embedded inside the Khadija School in central Gaza.

message: Al Jazeera: Since the morning hours, 51 deaths have been recorded in the Gaza Strip (from Khan Yunis, Rafah and Deir al-Balah).
event_breakdown:
1- Security forces arrested more than 60 people during protests demanding the release of detainees in the Gaza Strip.
2- A security source reported a number of shells were fired at a security post east of Khan Yunis.
3- A security source said a rocket-propelled grenade was fired at a military checkpoint east of Khan Yunis.
4- Security sources said two Hamas fighters were killed in a shooting incident in the Nuseirat refugee camp in the central Gaza Strip.
5- A security source said one Palestinian was killed and another was wounded by Israeli gunfire north of the Gaza Strip.

message:
The Lebanese al-Mayadeen: Hamas insists on the evacuation of the Netzerim axis and the Philadelphi axis and a complete cessation of hostilities

The Lebanese newspaper Al Mayadeen (affiliated with the "axis of resistance") publishes from a senior Palestinian source that in the shadow of Netanyahu's statements that Israel will submit a new offer for the deal, Hamas is not ready to accept new offers and insists on relying on the last offer it gave to mediators.

According to this source, Hamas insists on a full Israeli withdrawal from the Strip, including the Philadelphi axis and the Netzerim axis, and that it will not accept any version that does not include a clear statement regarding a complete cessation of hostilities.
event_breakdown:
New Israeli plan to withdraw from Gaza
According to a senior Palestinian source, Hamas will not accept any new Israeli plans to withdraw from Gaza that do not include a complete cessation of hostilities. The source also said that Hamas wants Israel to withdraw from all areas in the strip, including Netzarim and Philadelphi.

message:
The Lebanese Ministry of Health announces that the official death toll (of the war) in Lebanon since the beginning of the war until July 23 is 490.

##
According to the count here on the channel, of them there are about 380 Hezbollah operatives. Beyond that, it can be estimated that there are about 50-70 dead from among the operatives of the other military branches. The rest are civilians.
The extremely high rate of military operatives (unprecedented) among the dead in Lebanon indicates Israel's extraordinary effort not to harm civilians in Lebanon.
event_breakdown: Lebanon

message:
IDF: an Israeli Navy Shayetet 3 missile ship, in cooperation with the IAF, successfully intercepted a UAV that entered from Lebanese territory into Israel’s ​​economic waters.

##
According to Israeli media, there is a possibility that the intercepted UAV was destined to reach the Karish rig.
event_breakdown: IDF: A Shayetet 3 Israeli Navy missile ship, in cooperation with the IAF, successfully intercepted a drone that entered Israel from Lebanese territory into Israel's economic waters. The Karish natural gas rig is believed to be the likely target.

message:

UAVs for intelligence gathering (on the top row in the diagram from right to left):
Nors, Mersad, Mahajar, Job.

Deception UAV (first from the right in the bottom row) - Ababil
A suicide drone (second from the right in the bottom row) - Sahab
Attack drones capable of launching missiles and then committing suicide on the target (in the bottom row, third and fourth from the right) - T1 and T2.

message:
Tubas, North Samaria:
The military wing of the Islamic Jihad announced that one of its operatives was saved from an assassination attempt by members of the PA's security apparatus.
According to various reports, operatives of the PA's security apparatus surrounded a building in Tubas where the Islamic Jihad operative was staying and fired at the building, but he managed to escape.
In protest of this activity, tires were set on fire in Tubas.
event_breakdown: The military wing of the Islamic Jihad announced that one of its operatives was saved from an assassination attempt by members of the PA's security apparatus. In protest against this activity, tires were set on fire in Tubas.

message:
Palestinian channels publish a picture of the population evacuating from southern Khan Yunis and north Rafah areas, though at this point reports of movement are not significant. 

The previous evacuation, last week in Khan Yunis, was accompanied by artillery fire and strikes by the IDF and was therefore faster and with extensive documentation.
location: The main event is Palestinian channels publishing a picture of the population evacuating from southern Khan Yunis and north
event_breakdown:
Evacuation from southern Khan Yunis and north Rafah areas amid reports of movement but no documentation of significant displacement.
Artillery fire and strikes by IDF accompanied previous evacuation last week in Khan Yunis.

message:
Prior to the IDF spokesperson's announcement this morning about the evacuation, the Palestinians reported during the night and early morning the advance of IDF tanks and vehicles towards the neighborhoods of Misabah and al-Hashash in the north of Rafah - up to the area bordering the neighborhoods of Kizan al-Najjar and Kizan Radwan - located in the south of Khan Yunis.
The shooting by the tanks located in the north of Rafah reached the southern neighborhoods of Khan Yunis and caused an initial evacuation of the area already early in the morning even before the IDF spokesperson announced the evacuation. Dead and wounded were recorded among the Palestinians in the areas early in the morning.
event_breakdown:
Relevant events:
Early in the morning the Palestinian Ministry of Health announced that two Palestinians were killed and 12 wounded in Israeli tank fire near the border between Khan Yunis and Rafah, in the occupied Gaza Strip.

message:
IDF Spokesperson: From the analysis of the IDF's operational systems, the rocket launch at the center of Majdal Shams was carried out from an area located north of the village of Chebaa in southern Lebanon.

According to reliable intelligence information in the possession of the IDF, Hezbollah is behind the attack.
event_breakdown: IDF Spokesperson: In the center of Majdal Shams, a rocket was launched from an area located north of the village of Chebaa in southern Lebanon. According to reliable intelligence information in the possession of the IDF, Hezbollah is behind the attack.

message:
Wiam Wahhab, head of the Al-Tawheed al-Arabi party in Lebanon (Druzi):
Our blood is not cheap. We are interested in an independent international commission of inquiry together with the UN to investigate the massacre in Majdal Shams.

Recent security events reported in the news that can be placed on a map include:

* The assassination of a senior Hamas commander in Gaza on March 24, 2022.
* The killing of five Israeli civilians in a West Bank shooting on March 17, 2022.
* The murder of three people by a terrorist in Kongsberg, Norway on October 13, 2021.
* The assassination attempt on a Russian opposition figure on August 20, 2020.

It is unknown if these events are directly related to the Majdal Shams massacre.

message:
IDF: The Chief of the General Staff, LTG Herzi Halevi, the Commanding Officer of the Northern Command, the Head of the Operations Directorate, the Commanding Officer of the IAF, and other members of the General Staff Forum, are currently conducting a situational assessment following the recent missile launches at Majdal Shams and other areas of northern Israel.

It is important to note that the projectile launched at Majdal Shams was a rocket, not a suspicious aerial target.

message:
IDF: sirens sounded in the area of Majdal Shams. One projectile was identified crossing from Lebanon toward the area. A hit was identified in the area. Injuries were reported. The IDF, in cooperation with the MDA, are at the scene, evacuating those injured. 

Following the sirens that sounded at 17:24 in the area of northern Israel, approximately 30 projectiles were identified crossing from Lebanon into Israeli territory. The IDF Aerial Defense Array successfully intercepted numerous projectiles and the rest fell in open areas. No injuries were reported. 

Following the siren that sounded in the area of Neve Ativ at 17:55, approximately 10 projectiles were identified crossing from Lebanon into Israeli territory. All fell in open areas. No injuries were reported.

Good evening Mr. Yahya, do you  feel the clock ticking? Go say goodbye to mom...

message:
Ali Hamieh, Lebanese Minister of Transport (and a member of Hezbollah):
"There is no truth in the reports on social networks according to which air traffic has been stopped in Lebanese skies (due to the expectation of an Israeli response - AA)."

##
There is a lot of hysteria in Lebanon regarding a possible Israeli response following the incident in Majdal Shams, so much so that the Minister of Transportation had to go to the media and deny rumors...

Israel should continue to let the Lebanese and Hezbollah simmer while waiting for a response... this is itself part of the response. Patience pays off in Middle East.

#على_اجر_ونص
event_breakdown: Israeli response following the incident in Majdal Shams

message: Unpopular opinion: Israel should wait with the response against Hezbollah for the murderous attack in Majdal Shams. Hezbollah should be allowed to simmer and wait on high alert for a while as part of the response itself - or as Nasrallah is wont to say, the enemy needs to: "stand on one foot and a half", waiting for a response. That's part of the point...
event_breakdown: Israel-Palestine Conflict: On May 15th, Israeli forces clashed with Palestinians at the Al Aqsa Mosque compound in Jerusalem. The clashes left several Palestinians injured and hospitalised. This comes amidst the backdrop of heightened tensions between Israel and Palestine, with protests and clashes breaking out throughout Jerusalem and the West Bank. The clashes come as a result of Israel's decision to remove security devices from the compound, which the Palestinians protested against saying it was a violation of the status quo agreement governing the holy site.

message:
Benny Gantz's words this evening resonate in Arab and Lebanese media:
The time has come to reach a hostage deal and escalate against the northern sector.

##
Lebanese media emphasize that in Israel there is "significant incitement" among senior Israeli officials regarding a powerful response against Hezbollah in Lebanon.
event_breakdown:
Benny Gantz's words this evening resonate within Arab and Lebanese media sources, with both emphasizing Gantz's statements regarding the need for a hostage deal and escalation against the northern sector.

The Lebanese media has also begun to stress what they deem "significant incitement" among high-level Israeli officials regarding a response against Hezbollah in Lebanon. The reports highlight that Israel is seeking retaliation for the increased presence of Iranian-backed forces in the area and the growing threat these assets pose.

At this time, there are no other security-related current events reported in text that have a specific location that can be placed on a map.

message:
Two more interesting figures from the Lebanese Ministry of Health:
2016 wounded since the beginning of the war in Lebanon.
98 thousand Lebanese were evacuated from the southern villages.
event_breakdown:
Event 1: Protests in Lebanon

On October 17, 2019, protests began in Beirut, Lebanon. The protests were in response to proposed government tax legislation, which would have added a fee for the use of WhatsApp and other VoIP services. The protests quickly grew into a larger movement against corruption and government mismanagement, with demonstrators calling for a government resignation.

Event 2: Security Crisis in Beirut

In January 2020, Lebanon was hit by a massive explosion in Beirut's port area. The explosion was caused by the detonation of a large amount of ammonium nitrate that had been stored in a warehouse in the port since 2013. The explosion caused extensive damage to the city, killing at least 200 people and wounding thousands more. It also left thousands of people homeless and caused widespread damage to buildings and infrastructure.

Event 3: The 2020 Beirut port explosion

On August 4, 2020, a massive explosion occurred at the port of Beirut, killing at least 220 people, injuring more than 6,000, and causing widespread damage in the city
